data.enText: flung
flung
to throw sb/sth somewhere with force, especially because you are angry

data.chText: 有人把一块砖扔进了窗户。
data.enText: Someone had flung a brick through the window.
He flung her to the ground.
The door was suddenly flung open.
He had his enemies flung into prison .
to move yourself or part of your body suddenly and with a lot of force
She flung herself onto the bed.

data.chText: 他猛伸手臂扶她，她才没有跌倒。
data.enText: He flung out an arm to stop her from falling.

data.chText: 粗暴地（向某人）说；气势汹汹地（对某人）说
data.enText: to say sth to sb in an aggressive way
They were flinging insults at each other.
fling yourself at sb

data.chText: （太露骨地）向某人求爱；向（异性）献殷勤
data.enText: to make it too obvious to sb that you want to have a sexual relationship with them
fling yourself into sth
to start to do sth with a lot of energy and enthusiasm

data.chText: 他们一心一意地准备聚会。
data.enText: They flung themselves into the preparations for the party.
fling sth↔off/on
to take off or put on clothing in a quick and careless way

data.chText: 他随手脱掉大衣，倒在沙发上。
data.enText: He flung off his coat and collapsed on the sofa.
fling sb↔out
to make sb leave a place suddenly
fling sth↔out
to get rid of sth that you do not want any longer

data.chText: 一阵尽情欢乐；一时的放纵
data.enText: a short period of enjoyment when you do not allow yourself to worry or think seriously about anything

data.chText: 他决心在退休前最后痛痛快快地玩乐一番。
data.enText: He was determined to have one last fling before retiring.
a short sexual relationship with sb

data.text: throw ♦ toss ♦ hurl ♦ fling ♦ chuck ♦ lob ♦ bowl ♦ pitch

data.chText: 以上各词均含扔、投、掷、抛之义。
data.enText: All these words mean to send sth from your hand through the air.
throw
to send sth from your hand or hands through the air

data.chText: 有些孩子在朝窗户扔石头。
data.enText: Some kids were throwing stones at the window.

data.chText: 她把球抛出来，他接住了。
data.enText: She threw the ball and he caught it.
toss

data.chText: 指轻轻或漫不经心地扔、抛、掷：
data.enText: to throw sth lightly or carelessly

data.chText: 她把她的短上衣丢到床上。
data.enText: She tossed her jacket onto the bed.
hurl
to throw sth violently in a particular direction

data.chText: 暴徒把一块砖猛地扔向汽车，砸破了挡风玻璃。
data.enText: Rioters hurled a brick through the car's windscreen.
fling

data.chText: 尤指生气地或急匆匆地用力扔、掷、抛、丢：
data.enText: to throw sb/sth somewhere with a lot of force, especially because you are angry or in a hurry
She flung the letter down onto the table.
chuck
( especially BrE informal ) to throw sth carelessly
I chucked him the keys.
lob

data.chText: 指往空中高扔、高抛、高掷：
data.enText: ( informal ) to throw sth so that it goes high through the air

data.chText: 他们在朝墙那边扔石头。
data.enText: They were lobbing stones over the wall.
bowl
(in cricket) to throw the ball to the batsman
pitch
(in baseball) to throw the ball to the batter
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck/lob/bowl/pitch sth at/to sb/sth
to throw/toss/fling/chuck/lob sb sth
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck sth aside/away
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck/lob/bowl/pitch a ball
to throw/toss/hurl/fling/chuck/lob stones/a brick
to throw/toss/hurl/fling sth angrily
to throw/toss/fling/chuck sth casually/carelessly

ex.enText: He can throw a hundred yards.

ex.chText: 他投出了最后那颗手榴弹。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用力抛掷，不涉及动作方式或感情色彩。

ex.enText: How many times did he cast/throw his net every morning?

ex.chText: 别忘了往火堆里加木块。
ex.enText: Don't forget to cast more wood on the fire.

synonyms.bx: 多指迅速扔出一个较轻的物体，如书、球、包等，常可与 throw 换用。

ex.enText: He flung the coin into the river.

ex.chText: 毕业生们欢呼着把学士帽扔向空中。
ex.enText: The graduates cheered and flung their trencher caps into the air.

ex.chText: 她把文件往桌子上一摔便气冲冲地走了。
ex.enText: She flung the papers on the desk and left angrily.

synonyms.bx: 指用力投掷；也可指感情激动时粗鲁而随便地扔东西，此时常伴有某种较强烈的感情色彩。

ex.enText: He pitched the wallet into the box.

ex.chText: 他把那张名片扔进火里。
ex.enText: He pitched the name card into the fire.

synonyms.bx: 通常指仔细瞄准后用力地掷或扔，侧重方向性及明确的目标。

ex.chText: 他妻子把报纸扔给了他。
ex.enText: His wife tossed him the newspaper.

synonyms.bx: 尤指随意地扔、掷比较轻的东西，如书、报纸等。

data.enText: fling yourself at sb

data.chText: （太露骨地）向某人求爱；向（异性）献殷勤
data.enText: to make it too obvious to sb that you want to have a sexual relationship with them
fling yourself into sth
to start to do sth with a lot of energy and enthusiasm

data.chText: 他们一心一意地准备聚会。
data.enText: They flung themselves into the preparations for the party.
fling sth↔off/on
to take off or put on clothing in a quick and careless way

data.chText: 他随手脱掉大衣，倒在沙发上。
data.enText: He flung off his coat and collapsed on the sofa.
fling sb↔out
to make sb leave a place suddenly
fling sth↔out
to get rid of sth that you do not want any longer

tr: a brief indulgence of your impulses

example: he took a crack at it

tr: move in an abrupt or headlong manner
example: He flung himself onto the sofa
I splurged on a new TV

value.def: If you fling something somewhere, you throw it there using a lot of force.

example.ex: The woman flung the cup at him...
example.tran: 那个女人使劲把杯子朝他扔去。

example.ex: He once seized my knitting, flinging it across the room.
example.tran: 有一次他抓过我织的东西，把它扔到了屋子的另一头。

value.def: If you fling yourself somewhere, you move or jump there suddenly and with a lot of force.

example.ex: He flung himself to the floor.

value.def: If you fling a part of your body in a particular direction, especially your arms or head, you move it there suddenly.

example.ex: She flung her arms around my neck and kissed me.
example.tran: 她突然张开手臂搂住我的脖子，然后吻了我一下。

value.tran: 急伸，猛动(尤指头或手臂)

value.def: If you fling someone to the ground, you push them very roughly so that they fall over.

example.ex: The youth got him by the front of his shirt and flung him to the ground.
example.tran: 年轻人抓住他的衬衫前襟，把他摔在了地上。

value.def: If you fling something into a particular place or position, you put it there in a quick or angry way.

example.ex: Peter flung his shoes into the corner...
example.tran: 彼得把他的鞋子甩到角落里。

example.ex: He flung it down on the desk.

value.def: If you fling yourself into a particular activity, you do it with a lot of enthusiasm and energy.

example.ex: She flung herself into her career...

example.tran: 我全身心投入诗歌创作。

value.def: If two people have a fling, they have a brief sexual relationship.

example.ex: She claims she had a brief fling with him 30 years ago.
example.tran: 她声称在 30 年前曾和他有过一段短暂的风流韵事。

value.def: A fling is a short period of enjoyment, especially the last one that you will get an opportunity to have.

example.ex: ...that last fling before you finally give up and take up a job.
example.tran: 你最终收心并开始工作之前的最后一次放纵

value.tran: 短暂的放纵;一时的尽情享乐

value.def: Fling can be used instead of 'throw' in many expressions that usually contain 'throw'.

trans: 高地舞(轻快苏格兰单人舞)
